intro: Adenocalymma bullatum, commonly known as the woolly adenocalymma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is a perennial shrub that can reach heights of up to 1 meter, with compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it requires well-drained soil and moderate watering.
